{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks which hormone(s) are under inhibitory control of the hypothalamus. Document [0] states that the release of prolactin is under the main inhibitory control of hypothalamic dopamine. Document [1] mentions that somatostatin (also known as Growth Hormone Inhibiting Hormone) is the main regulator for the release of Growth Hormone (GH) from the pituitary gland.
